segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 46
segments.en: Linked Discourses 46

segments.pli: 6. Sākacchavagga
segments.en: 6. Discussion

segments.pli: 56. Abhayasutta
segments.en: 56. A Place Without Fear

segments.pli: Evaṃ me sutaṃ—
segments.en: So I have heard.

segments.pli: ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā rājagahe viharati gijjhakūṭe pabbate.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Rājagaha, on the Vulture’s Peak Mountain.

segments.pli: Atha kho abhayo rājakumāro yena bhagavā tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā bhagavantaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinno kho abhayo rājakumāro bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Prince Abhaya went up to the Buddha, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him:

segments.pli: “pūraṇo, bhante, kassapo evamāha:
segments.en: “Sir, Pūraṇa Kassapa says this:

segments.pli: ‘natthi hetu, natthi paccayo aññāṇāya adassanāya.
segments.en: ‘There is no cause or condition for not knowing and not seeing.

segments.pli: Ahetu, appaccayo aññāṇaṃ adassanaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Not knowing and not seeing have no cause or condition.

segments.pli: Natthi hetu, natthi paccayo ñāṇāya dassanāya.
segments.en: There is no cause or condition for knowing and seeing.

segments.pli: Ahetu, appaccayo ñāṇaṃ dassanaṃ hotī’ti.
segments.en: Knowing and seeing have no cause or condition.’

segments.pli: Idha bhagavā kimāhā”ti?
segments.en: What does the Buddha say about this?”

segments.pli: “Atthi, rājakumāra, hetu, atthi paccayo aññāṇāya adassanāya.
segments.en: “Prince, there are causes and conditions for not knowing and not seeing.

segments.pli: Sahetu, sappaccayo aññāṇaṃ adassanaṃ hoti.
segments.en: Not knowing and not seeing have causes and conditions.

segments.pli: Atthi, rājakumāra, hetu, atthi paccayo ñāṇāya dassanāya.
segments.en: There are causes and conditions for knowing and seeing.

segments.pli: Sahetu, sappaccayo ñāṇaṃ dassanaṃ hotī”ti.
segments.en: Knowing and seeing have causes and conditions.”

segments.pli: “Katamo pana, bhante, hetu, katamo paccayo aññāṇāya adassanāya?
segments.en: “But sir, what is the cause and condition for not knowing and not seeing?

segments.pli: Kathaṃ sahetu, sappaccayo aññāṇaṃ adassanaṃ hotī”ti?
segments.en: How do not knowing and not seeing have causes and conditions?”

segments.pli: “Yasmiṃ kho, rājakumāra, samaye kāmarāgapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati kāmarāgaparetena, uppannassa ca kāmarāgassa nissaraṇaṃ yathābhūtaṃ na jānāti na passati—
segments.en: “There’s a time when the heart is overcome and mired in sensual desire, without truly knowing and seeing the escape from sensual desire that has arisen.

segments.pli: ayampi kho, rājakumāra, hetu, ayaṃ paccayo aññāṇāya adassanāya.
segments.en: This is a cause and condition for not knowing and not seeing.

segments.pli: Evampi sahetu sappaccayo aññāṇaṃ adassanaṃ hoti.
segments.en: And this is how not knowing and not seeing have causes and conditions.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, rājakumāra, yasmiṃ samaye byāpādapariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati byāpādaparetena … pe …
segments.en: Furthermore, there’s a time when the heart is overcome and mired in ill will …

segments.pli: thinamiddhapariyuṭṭhitena … pe …
segments.en: dullness and drowsiness …

segments.pli: uddhaccakukkuccapariyuṭṭhitena … pe …
segments.en: restlessness and remorse …

segments.pli: vicikicchāpariyuṭṭhitena cetasā viharati vicikicchāparetena, uppannāya ca vicikicchāya nissaraṇaṃ yathābhūtaṃ na jānāti na passati—
segments.en: doubt, without truly knowing and seeing the escape from doubt that has arisen.

segments.pli: ayampi kho, rājakumāra, hetu, ayaṃ paccayo aññāṇāya adassanāya.
segments.en: This is a cause and condition for not knowing and not seeing.

segments.pli: Evampi sahetu sappaccayo aññāṇaṃ adassanaṃ hotī”ti.
segments.en: And this is how not knowing and not seeing have causes and conditions.”

segments.pli: “Ko nāmāyaṃ, bhante, dhammapariyāyo”ti?
segments.en: “Sir, what is the name of this exposition of the teaching?”

segments.pli: “Nīvaraṇā nāmete, rājakumārā”ti.
segments.en: “These are called the ‘hindrances’, prince.”

segments.pli: “Taggha, bhagavā, nīvaraṇā;
segments.en: “Indeed, Blessed One, these are hindrances!

segments.pli: taggha, sugata, nīvaraṇā.
segments.en: Indeed, Holy One, these are hindrances!

segments.pli: Ekamekenapi kho, bhante, nīvaraṇena abhibhūto yathābhūtaṃ na jāneyya na passeyya, ko pana vādo pañcahi nīvaraṇehi?
segments.en: Overcome by even a single hindrance you wouldn’t truly know or see, let alone all five hindrances.

segments.pli: Katamo pana, bhante, hetu, katamo paccayo ñāṇāya dassanāya?
segments.en: But sir, what is the cause and condition for knowing and seeing?

segments.pli: Kathaṃ sahetu, sappaccayo ñāṇaṃ dassanaṃ hotī”ti?
segments.en: How do knowing and seeing have causes and conditions?”

segments.pli: “Idha, rājakumāra, bhikkhu satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
segments.en: “It’s when a mendicant develops the awakening factor of mindfulness, which relies on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripens as letting go.

segments.pli: So satisambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāvitena cittena yathābhūtaṃ jānāti passati—
segments.en: They truly know and see with a mind that has developed the awakening factor of mindfulness.

segments.pli: ayampi kho, rājakumāra, hetu, ayaṃ paccayo ñāṇāya dassanāya.
segments.en: This is a cause and condition for knowing and seeing.

segments.pli: Evampi sahetu, sappaccayo ñāṇaṃ dassanaṃ hoti.
segments.en: And this is how knowing and seeing have causes and conditions.

segments.pli: Puna caparaṃ, rājakumāra, bhikkhu … pe … upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāveti vivekanissitaṃ virāganissitaṃ nirodhanissitaṃ vossaggapariṇāmiṃ.
segments.en: Furthermore, a mendicant develops the awakening factor of investigation of principles... energy... rapture... tranquility... immersion... equanimity, which rely on seclusion, fading away, and cessation, and ripen as letting go.

segments.pli: So upekkhāsambojjhaṅgaṃ bhāvitena cittena yathābhūtaṃ jānāti passati—
segments.en: They truly know and see with a mind that has developed the awakening factor of equanimity.

segments.pli: ayampi kho, rājakumāra, hetu, ayaṃ paccayo ñāṇāya dassanāya.
segments.en: This is a cause and condition for knowing and seeing.

segments.pli: Evaṃ sahetu, sappaccayo ñāṇaṃ dassanaṃ hotī”ti.
segments.en: And this is how knowing and seeing have causes and conditions.”

segments.pli: “Ko nāmāyaṃ, bhante, dhammapariyāyo”ti?
segments.en: “Sir, what is the name of this exposition of the teaching?”

segments.pli: “Bojjhaṅgā nāmete, rājakumārā”ti.
segments.en: “These are called the ‘awakening factors’, prince.”

segments.pli: “Taggha, bhagavā, bojjhaṅgā;
segments.en: “Indeed, Blessed One, these are awakening factors!

segments.pli: taggha, sugata, bojjhaṅgā.
segments.en: Indeed, Holy One, these are awakening factors!

segments.pli: Ekamekenapi kho, bhante, bojjhaṅgena samannāgato yathābhūtaṃ jāneyya passeyya, ko pana vādo sattahi bojjhaṅgehi?
segments.en: Endowed with even a single awakening factor you would truly know and see, let alone all seven awakening factors.

segments.pli: Yopi me, bhante, gijjhakūṭaṃ pabbataṃ ārohantassa kāyakilamatho cittakilamatho, sopi me paṭippassaddho, dhammo ca me abhisamito”ti.
segments.en: When climbing Mount Vulture’s Peak I became fatigued in body and mind. But this has now faded away. And I’ve comprehended the teaching.”

segments.pli: Chaṭṭhaṃ.
Sākacchavaggo chaṭṭho.
Āhārā pariyāyamaggi,
mettaṃ saṅgāravena ca;
Abhayo pucchito pañhaṃ,
gijjhakūṭamhi pabbateti.

suttaplex.blurb: Prince Abhaya reports Pūraṇa Kassapa’s view that there is no cause for ignorance or knowledge, and asks the Buddha’s opinion. The Buddha replies that the cause of ignorance is the hindrances, and the cause of knowledge is the awakening factors.
